Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated-poor Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GaryHarper
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated BW near Disney World- quiet location. Nice beds and large flat screen TV. good rates. Very clean. front desk girl and others were very helfull and pleasant. Nice choice if wanting to be a little quiet and near Disney World. RMs a little small but did not mind. Breakfast area was way too small and not great but fine for a coffee and light snake in your room. Would recomend for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “avery good value”
Reviews.Author: samarshahin
Reviews.Content: I visited Orlando on the 27th of Feb to attend conference there,the hotel is 10 walk from onvention centre,its rooms are extremly nice and clean,it has large rooms and large bathroom,brekfast is average not a lot of items but its ok, they offer tea and coffee the whole day for free.It is near Disney with free shuttle.I like it and recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: lsly_031
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 2 nights in February. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms. They are very nice! Very clean & very modern. The people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was ok but its hotel food, how great can that be. If you are looking for a nice hotel at a good price this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SubNormale
Reviews.Content: Been there mid Feb for a 3dd stay. Hotel has been recently acquired (I think it was a Sleep Inn?) renovated and re-opened. Rooms are indeed in an excellent condition, probably a little bit too small but we just needed a place to spleep (I do not think that anyone would go to Orlando to stay in a hotel room) Breakfast was a ver ysimple continental breakfast with muffin, waffles (do it yourself), donuts, juices and some hot food: eggs and meat (either sausages or hamburger or other stuff). They are in a walking distance (10min) from the Sea World entrance (we saved 15? dollars on the day we went there). We paid less than 80USD/dd (tax included) Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near it all”
Reviews.Author: mpt98
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here. Location is great - just off International Dr. so close to restaurants and Sea World, Universal etc. - yet quiet since it is a block off from the noise. Convenience store, gas station and mini mall as well as various restaurants right there. Recently renovated but some of the reno work is not quite done right. But this is really all we could find wrong. Staff were excellent, and I mean excellent in every way. Price was great and we would stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest 2.5 Star Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: writerguy1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights the last week of January and had an excellent stay. The room itself was a little on the small side with two beds, a desk, fridge and 2 chairs in it, but was very functional. The overall cleanliness of the room was simply exceptional. I don't even think many 4 or 5 star hotels I have stayed at have ever been cleaner. The room was pristine. Only downside was that there was no bathtub, just a shower. Not a problem for me but could be hard if you stayed here with kids. My room was on the 3rd floor right by the elevator and I couldn't believe I never heard another guest from inside my room for the entire stay. Very quiet hotel. The free continental breakfast was very basic. They served eggs and canadian bacon every morning and they were sort of edible. This hotel originally was a Sleep Inn, but was completely remodeled and was the sort of remodel were the hotel is was completely upgraded. Location wise it is right by Sea World, you can see Journey to Atlantis and the Kraken every morning as you leave. It is off of the first exit on 528, don't let this scare you, there are NO tolls if you get off at the first exit. I - 4 is less than a mile away from the hotel. All the attractions are 10 minutes or less from the hotel. Overall I highly recommend this hotel, it is on the southern end of the International Drive corridor. Many hotels on International Drive, especially towards Universal and Wet N'Wild, are really beginning to show their age. The the South Side of the Convention Center area is really the place to be and this hotel puts you into the heart of it. If you not staying at a Disney Property, this is the place I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elly
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, updated hotel but the rooms are very "compact". Two of us did well, but if you're thinking of putting more than 2 in the room, it will be cramped. Our shower was very small. Front desk was very helpful and the free breakfast was excellent - eggs, cereal, sausage, juices, and a pancake maker.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1155
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 2 days, and only have good thing to say. Great location for a room near the Conv Center under $ 90-, the place is clean with amenities like pool and small workout room, business center, computer to print boarding passes and check email, free wireless. The rooms are new, clean and very comfortable, with large screen LCD TVs, comfy beds and pillows , and clean bathrooms. Another great deal is the included breakfast. It is not a cheap-o " continental " ,stale bread and cereal with some under ripe fruit thrown in, breakfast. They have a choice of 3- 4 breads, jelly peanut butter cream cheese- and pastries, sausage or ham, pancakes, very industrial looking egg medallions, mixed fruit ( canned) yogurt, cereal and fruits, juice and coffee/tea. Good connections by trolly or bus or you can walk if you have some time and feel like it. Hard to beat a place like this for a tourist class hotel. This place would kill in Europe at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Have rebooked for this year”
Reviews.Author: traveller2801
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 when the hotel was being re furbished and was lucky enough to have been given a brand new room! The room was perfect and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was more than adequate and for a small hotel it is friendly and seved your needs. We are coming back this summer and compared to alot of hotels that are old and dated it is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: I stopped here with a friend in December 2011 and we couldn't believe the value for money we found! It's a stones throw away from International Drive and is connected to it by the i-Ride trolley service, and it has a Lynx bus stop almost right outside which connects to the Disney resort. Alternatively it runs it's own shuttle buses to many of the parks if you don't mind going slightly later. Our room was very spacious, 2 double beds and a massive tv, plus excellent bathroom facilities. We only paid around Â£29 per night for this hotel and we were amazed how good it was for that price. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone! And visit the nearby Orena Sports Bar!

Reviews.Title: “How early is breakfast open?”
Reviews.Author: OntarioGolfers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at Best Western Plus Orlando Gateway and thoroughly enjoyed it. This time we have booked the BW Plus Orlando Convention Centre Hotel as it is closer to the conference I will be attending. My sessions start early. Can anyone tell me what time breakfast opens and is there coffee available at 6 a.m.? Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “wondddderful stay”
Reviews.Author: rakeshjari
Reviews.Content: we stayed with BW convention center during our 1st visit to Disney world. All the front desk staff including Ms Rosemarry, Ms Carolina, Mr Derek and the night auditor (sorry i didnot get the name) were so helpful all the time. Lady who works in breakfast (sorry, I forget to ask your name) works hard everyday was so helpful and active. The room was small, but beds were comfy. pls keep microwave in the room it will help a lot. It does have business center with 3 computers and a printer, its fantastic...I have seen it first time. normally we see it just one computer. we stayed there 5 days. and enjoy the hot bf with scrable eggs, english muffins, waffles, juice etc., overall we recomand this hotel to all travelers. it was just 15 min away from disney and downtown was 3 miles. Jariwala family

Reviews.Title: “Dec 7th, 2011”
Reviews.Author: KelownaCanda
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay in early Dec 2011. Hotel is completely remodelled. The only negative is that the rooms are very small if there are more than 2 people in the room. Great location, lots of parking, close to Disney, Sea World, Convention Centre etc. Lightning fast wifi also. Do not hesitate to stay here especially given rates are awesome. Again, only negative is rooms are small but totally modern.

Reviews.Title: “Lost reservation TWICE!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff J
Reviews.Content: I am glad I printed off my conformation for my reservations here. I stayed two non consecutive nights, and both times, my reservation was lost. The first night they gave it to someone else! The rooms were fine and comfortable, however it was frustrating getting in late in the evening both nights I stayed this last week having to argue over a reservation and show proof I made them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Marcuscouf
Reviews.Content: Its clean, the price is good, great location !!! Im from brazil and this is always my first choice

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the convention center”
Reviews.Author: wnoppamas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending the meeting at the convention center. The room was in good size, clean and quiet. It was only 10- 15 minutes walk to the parking lot at the convention center.The staffs were nice. Parking was free at the hotel. I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I have to attend the meeting in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mortz186
Reviews.Content: There has obviously been a lot of effort put into this hotel, and it shows. Both inside and out have been freshly decorated in pleasant, conservative decor and the breakfast area, whilst small, provided typical fare-cereal, pastries, egg patties, sausage and an awsome automatic pancake maker. Coffee is always available throughout the day. The only slight downer was the pool could have done with a bit more cleaning and heating, but at the end of November I guess that could be cost prohibitive. The price, quality and convenience to Seaworld (10 minutes walk) made this as close to perfect for our needs as we could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaAnnie
Reviews.Content: This newly renovated hotel was clean, quiet and very nice. The staff was great! The rooms were a bit small, but well decorated and adequate for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than before”
Reviews.Author: UnderwaterDiva
Reviews.Content: We've been using this hotel while attending scuba trade shows at the convention center for several years. It was fine when it was the Sleep Inn, now it's even better as the Best Western. Our room was updated and surprisingly quiet, and has a good-sized refrigerator, high speed internet (bring a connecting cord) or wifi, and a flat TV. The included breakfast has been expanded, including a pancake machine, cereal, orange & apple juice, coffee, tea, oranges, pastries, toast, bagels, English muffins, sausage or bacon on different days, and some strange looking scrambled eggs. I didn't have the eggs, but my husband made an "Egg McMuffin" type sandwich every day and said it wasn't bad. There is a microwave available. There was a computer in the lobby, two in the business center (one was working), with a printer, and two on the second floor in the alcove that looks down on the lobby. About a mile to the convention center. There are several nearby restaurants, and a convenience/grocery story near the convention center to buy a limited amount of groceries. We'll be staying there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this place. Excellent place for great price!”
Reviews.Author: RonnieP111
Reviews.Content: I just took my 2 nieces to Discovery Cove and SeaWorld for 2 days and was looking for a clean nice hotel that was not super expensive, like the ones on the Disney Properties, etc. but also nearby for inexpensive cab fairs. I found this place which was going through a name change to Best Western, and also some restoration. I was a little concerned. The folks at the hotel assured me that we would be well taken care of. Well, I was more than pleased at how clean and neat the place was, from the grounds, the lobby, and most of all the rooms. They had just put in new furniture, 42 inch flat screen TVs, and the beds were very comfortable. They provided free continental breakfast, which was just fine to get us started for the day. The manager was very courteous and allowed us an extended stay, due to our flight not leaving till 2pm. The only thing I would suggest is not using the transportation service that they called for your cab rides. They used the U.S.A Transportation & Tours, which were significantly more expensive than a regular cab, especially to the airport. Other than that, it was great, there were plenty of good places nearby to walk to and eat and buy food and drink, beer and wine, whatever you need. For the room costs, no where around can beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “A winner”
Reviews.Author: RLevene
Reviews.Content: The rooms, location and staff at this winning hotel are first rate. Recently renovated means the rooms are fabulous. New, clean walk in shower rooms, huge flat screen tv, full size fridge and safe. Beds are very comfortable. My only minor misgiving was the breakfast. The room is small and the quality of the cooked items soso but the muffins fruit and coffee are great and hey it's included so I feel bad even mentioning it. All the staff were so friendly without being pushy and the manager Derek is First rate. Nothing is too much trouble and any issues were resolved immediately. Ours was a wifi one that he dealt with fast. The location too is brilliant. 10 minutes walk from Seaworld saves you $15 parking fee and access to I-trolley and Lynx bus to get to all the other parks. Unlike lots of other hotels it is not right on top of a 6 lane motorway either!. I agonised over which hotel to choose before I went but this was so good I want to return right now. Thanks for a great stay to all at what was called the Windsor Inn and is now Best Wetern Plus. Don't hesitate book now before this gets too popular.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, free shuttle, generous breakfast - a real bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Lizardo23
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been renamed the Best Western Plus. When telling taxi drivers where you are staying, you may have to refer to it as the Windsor Inn or Sleep Inn. The confusion in names made it difficult for the airline to return a piece of lost baggage, since they didn't have the new name in their computer system. We booked our room on www.hotels.ca and got a room with 2 double beds for $49/night. I stayed here on October 18-21 to visit Universal Studios and do some shopping prior to a conference at the Orange County Convention Centre. As two female travelers, we felt safe and enjoyed the many perks of staying at this hotel. LOCATION: This hotel has a fantastic location! It's located right off I-Drive, and there is an I-Trolley stop right across the street. You can easily reach both outlet malls on the I-Trolley. There is a shuttle that takes guests to Universal Studios, SeaWorld and Disneyworld. They drop-off in the morning, and return for pick-up twice in the evening. This means that you have to stay at the park for a decent amount of time. The shuttle is quick and pain-free. BREAKFAST: The breakfasts are fantastic. It is hectic around 8:30 AM when everybody is getting ready to visit the theme-parks. This makes breakfast a rather rushed affair since there are limited tables, and it is not always desirable to sit outside because of the weather. The buffet consisted of: pancakes, bacon/sausage, eggs, pastries, oranges, and juice. Of course, all of the jam included corn syrup, as did the pancake syrup. There are whole-wheat English muffins. THEME PARK TICKETS: There is a person who sells tickets to the theme parks at a 'discount.' After talking to him, I determined that purchasing from his is not that different from purchasing online. He sells Universal Studios 2-day park-to-park passes for $130 cash, or $135 with a credit card. He also had Disneyworld tickets for $30 off, however, this only applied with a group of three or more, and this was with a special 'employee voucher,' for which you had to notify him one day in advance, and go with him to the park to purchase the tickets. From my observations of his interactions with other guests, he didn't seem particularly keen to garner business, so I would probably look around for better deals. AMENITIES: The rooms were simple, but great. They hotel is newly renovated, and each has a safe. Although the bathroom had a funky odour, I think this is more likely attributed to the smell in Orlando's tap water, rather than hotel cleanliness. STAFF: I cannot describe how wonderful the staff were. We were greeted by Derek, who directed us to our room, and provided suggestions on where to eat. We also met another staff member named Derek, who was most courteous and helpful. There was no problem stowing our luggage with the desk since we went to a theme park after checking out... however, I was rather shocked that they did not ask for any ID to make sure that we were the owners when picking up our luggage afterwards. OVERALL: A wonderful hotel, and a great way to save money, particularly with a family. There's a pool and gym, and this provides a simple and affordable, yet comfortable place to relax while in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent friendly staff, great central location.”
Reviews.Author: G B
Reviews.Content: We've been to Florida many times, but this was our first hotel stay. From our experience being in the Windsor Inn (now Best Western Plus - Orlando Convention Center Hotel) I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The staff - from the front desk, kitchen staff, housemaids and service staff are all friendly, warm, welcoming and helpful for local information They really do the extra little bit and couldn't be faulted. The ensuite room, in the middle of 2nd floor had 2 double beds, 42 inch lcd tv with sports and Disney info channel, a full size fridge, air con, plenty of storage with iron and board. A mini safe, wifi and free local calls are all available in the room. Rooms are cleaned daily to a high standard. A fitness room with excellent equipment is available to use. Breakfast is included with a limited but adequate buffet, the only slight negative is the breakfast area is on the small side, but we learned that timing our breakfast to avoid early risers and later families was best option. A suggestion for management would be to extend into the rear to complete the transformation and get 5/5. A decent size pool and pool deck with tables, chairs, parasols and sun loungers, all of which were regularly cleaned, are also available and shielded, with hedging, from general view. Laundry facilities at $4 wash and dry is situated at the end of the 2nd floor. The additional hotel charge at $2.50 daily for wifi, room safe and parking, is one of the best around. The location is central to all theme parks with a free shuttle bus available, Seaworld is a short 5 min walk, across the road and down the side of the Doubletree Hotel. There are plenty of restaurants within a pleasant 1 - 1.5 mile walk up International Drive, the very reasonable I-ride buses are also availabe. Thanks to all for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel brilliant location fantastic facilities and staff”
Reviews.Author: Sam L
Reviews.Content: This hotel has blown me away. Location is minutes from Seaworld (walking) with Lynx bus access to all parks. The room I had beats Disney pop century and gets close to the highest standards. Huge flat screen tv, full size fridge and safe, coffee machine etc. You name it you got it. Shower is a luxury walk in and big enough for 2. I think you can ignore any adverse review below as the refurb has transformed a good hotel into something much better. My bed wasnt hard but very comfortable. I haven't checked out yet but so far I am absolutely amazed at the value this offers. I am not easily pleased (see my review of the Village In) next door. Don't hesitate to book this as the rates must start to get higher. I can't believe the rate I got thru Expedia. And the staff are absolutely great. Not gushing but willing and able to do everything they can. My IPad didn't connect to the wi fi in the room. Within a day the company that installed the system had been contacted and I am now writing this on my iPad in the hotel. The is no reason to go anywhere else. This hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: lainee_7
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Windsor Inn. I stayed there for 7 nights at the beginning of October. The front desk staff was amazing and were quick to offer suggestions. The housekeeping staff was great as well, my room was always clean. The hotel itself is newly renovated. The hotel is a quick walk from Seaworld and provides a free shuttle to Disney. The free breakfast was pretty standard but had some of the best hotel coffe I`ve experienced. On the nights that I didn`t eat supper at the parks, I ate at a nearby restaurant called Village Inn. I usually just ate breakfast for supper but it was good and reasonably priced. I`m looking forward to returning for my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Going to seaworld? Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: bflower45
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for reasonable rates. Looks like that are at least 50% through renovations and the rooms are nice. Really is about an eight minute walk to seaworld which saved us parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs tweaking.”
Reviews.Author: mthole265
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windsor Inn for six days and overall our stay was good. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here if i wanted a fuss free, cheap and clean room for the night. Pros: The location!!! Seaworld is walking distance!!! Located on an i ride route, number 29 and 30 which was perfect for i drive attractions and away from the hussle and bussle of it all. Clean room, microwave and fridge, nice t.v. with loads of channels, loved the walk-in power shower, (no bath but then who has a bath at a hotel?) basic continental breakfast included, Housekeeping was fantastic!!! Got to try the food, especially the pies, at the Village inn restaurant next door to the hotel!!! Wow!!!! Cons: We checked late at night about 11pm and the check in was so fast, the guy at the front desk didn't tell us what time breakfast was etc actually he hardly spoke to us at all. He never even explained to us that the hotel was being renovated (i'm glad i was prepared from the reviews i read on tripadvisor beforehand) and apologise for the mess in the lobby at the time also how you had to be careful walking in certain areas due to it being an absolute building site!!! The hotel lobby looked like something from the film 'Carry on abroad'. I felt like i needed a hard hat!!! There was no iron in the room called down to the same guy who checked us in and he told us he would bring one up within ten minutes. Needless to say i was still waiting the next day so i left a note for housekeeping and an iron was provided. Thank you!!! Although wifi was provided free it didn't work on our apple products. Really disappointing. However when i got talking to a different guy on the front desk (who was sooo helpful and kind) he explained that the wifi didn't work with apple products and other guests were having problems too. He allowed me to use the office computer to send an e-mail to family back home which i appreciated a lot and felt that his customer service was impeccable. Thank you for that. The main light in our room was faulty and flickered constantly through the night, maintenance took the lightbulb out but took three days to get fixed properly. We used the lamps which wasn't a problem but having the main light would have saved from switching all the lamps off each time we left the room. Beds were too hard and the pillows were too soft! When i ask to call a cab they provided a private car company instead of a metered cab. The price was extortionate for the distance travelled. Please if you don't want to be ripped off call your own metered cab!!! 7am in the morning is not an appropriate time to being drilling. Renovation or no renovation!!!! Would have like some literature in the room about check in/out times, orlando etc, Overall the floor we stayed on was almost finished and our room was clean and the decor pleasant. Apart from the first guy who checked us, all the other staff really pleasant and couldn't help you enough. The hotel lobby was nearly finished when we left and it was looking lovely and plush. The hotel will look fabulous when it is all finished and i think i might leave staying here until it is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ClelX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for nine nights in September. I chose the hotel mainly for price and location being within walk distance of sea world and the nicer half of international drive and pointe Orlando. I have to say that of the many many times I have stayed in hotels in Florida, Derek on reception was the most helpful and friendly person we have ever met. The customer service at the hotel was superb. Derek couldn't help enough whether it was ensuring our room had the best view, assisting in purchasing cheap sea world tickets or advising on the best places for a run. The rooms aren't the biggest but considering the price, the hotel was spotless, pool was lovely and a free breakfast thrown in every morning too. As we were leaving laundry ice and making facilities had just been fitted and the whole hotel was close to being finished. Although there was still work going on in the hotel, there was very little noise and disruption and the staff really went out of their way to make sure it didn't spoil our stay. Thanks again Derek it was a pleasure meeting you and good luck with the half marathon you're running yourself, you're a credit to the Windsor Inn.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: shadow2658
Reviews.Content: came to Orlando from England the cost of staying at Windsor inn once known as Sleepy inn was very good the rooms were big and well kept. breakfast was very good liked what I had. Other hotals I stayed at while in the USA was not as good and i did pay more for them. I needed a taxi and they helped me book one. nothing was to much. I did look at the review some were not very good however I do beleive you can not judge a book by its cover you need to try it hot yourself. They are redecorating and inproving the sevices and will be changing the name what I have seen of the changes they will be for the better I am sure. Whould I rebook this hotal - inn the answer is very easy YES but I would book direct and not through a hotal web-site hotal said they will be flexi regarding if I had to cancal and change dates of my stay that I think is very good the service over all was very good I can not say that I was not happy for the 4 days I was they. That to all the staff at Windsor inn once known as Sleepy Inn. Janet Weston from the UK

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: buchanbuilder
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip here for 16 nights in July as we were coming from Scotland and needed extra time. We arrived to find the hotel in the middle of a renovation and at first had my doubts! I need not have worried. We were met at the front desk by very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was on the 2nd floor and was more that adequate and clean. We had a lovely walk in shower . There was coffee and tea making facilities in the room. We were at the front of the hotel but apart from hearing fireworks each night from Seaworld was never once bothered by any sort of noise or disturbance. We have stayed in larger and more expensive placs only to be annoyed but noisy corridors etc. The hotel has only got the one washer and dryer but is excellent value at $2 a load to wash and the same to dry and has a machine that sells detergent at a $1 a time. It is on the 2nd floor so we managed to do ours before breakfast or when home form parks. Our room had iron and ironing board, basic but who wants to spend ages ironing on holiday and has a dryer for hair as well. There is an area in the morning for free breakfast which at times can be busy but they have an outside area too. There are hot and cold drinks, cereal , breads for toast and pastries as well as porridge each morning. When this is provided free you save quite a bit. Some mornings we strolled to Village Inn, or Dennys for breakfast. When I saw the swimming pool I will admit I thought it on the small side at first but it was brillliant. For 99% of the time we were there we had the pool to ourselves it was bliss. There are a few chairs and recliners outside which could be probably updated. We did not bother taking towels with us who needs the extra weight we used the towels form our rooms and were able to get extra from the ladies who cleaned the rooms whenever we needed them. The hotel runs free shuttles to the parks but Sea World is only a 10 minute stroll away so we just walked each time. The shuttle and Lynx buses stop opposite the hotel and return outside the hotel what more could you ask for. Only once did we have quite a wait for a shuttle as there was a thunder storm on and everyone was leaving shuttles from Sea World. There are quite a few resteraunts next to the hotle Village Inn, lovely pies, Italian, Subway to name a few. Down the drive there are all the ususals like Dennys, IHop, Mcdonalds etc. Derek on the desk was very knowledgable about everything and gave us lots of good advice. There was a gentleman opposite the front desk selling trips. I read in an earlier comment that people thought he tried to rip them off. I have to disagree totally with this we arranged a day pass to the 4 Disney Parks through him and he gave us a fantastic bargain and transported us there along with others. We had pre paid all our other trips but would have been more than happy to try and arrange them with him. When we left the renovation was almost complete, the outside had been all freshly painted and when lit up at night was very welcoming. when I visit Florida again this will be my hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BUY FROM TICKET VENDOR IN LOBBY! POSSIBLE SCAMMER.”
Reviews.Author: CristyInMiami
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying at this hotel. The location and the price are great. For the price I get what I expect. One day the maids came and picked up the dirty towels but didnt make the beds. No biggie. The beds were a bit hard, agian no biggie, they were bearable. However, my number one complaint isnt directly with the hotel, but since thy were namesless, and were located INSIDE the hotel, they must take full responsibility for the experience. Living in Miami we often travel to Orlando, we always buy our tickets from the parks and never have an issue. This time we decided to buy from the guy selling in the lobby. My parents and I were a bit weary but my husband suggested getting it from the vendor. FIRST RED FLAG- When he gave us a price he clicked his calculator, and poceeded to say something to the effect of : $115 + $115= $330 + 110= $440. You can probably see the mistake quickly but when this is told to you really quickly you tend to miss it. My husband forked over $500 and in th back of my head it sounded like a lot, but my math isnt the best. Before, the transaction was over my mom leaned over and said "$115+$115 is $230 not $330". So I quickly jumped and asked and he looked like a deer caught in the headlights, he even redid the WRONG math...TWICE. Maybe his apology was sincere but I didnt buy it. I think he was trying to stiff us SO BEWARE!! SECOND RED FLAG- he doesnt take down any information nor does he give you a receipt. There is no proof you have purchased from him if paying in cash. Well, my dad lost his tickt that day at Seaworld and the park said they couldnt do anything since th ticket was bought from a 3rd party. We needed to talk to the vendor. The next day when we asked him for a relacement ticket he said that wasnt his job it was the park. Ugh- no, we bought it from you. In the end, my dad needed to buy another ticket. Had he bought it from the park they would have had record of it and the would have given us another. Th dudes missing an arm so you can't miss him. Someone told us that some of these places get the tickets from "an insider" in the park and have no affiliation with the park. The park would never admit that, but think about it, if the park were partnered with them they would have better control. Windsor Inn- stop allowing crooks to represent your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They are working on it”
Reviews.Author: Jeb1217
Reviews.Content: This property has recently been converted from a Sleep Inn to Windsor Inn. The new owners are in the process of refurbishing the entire hotel. At the time of my visit the building was being repainted and many of the rooms in the front were temporarily out of service as they replaced equipment. My room was in the back and in good condition. It had a in-room safe, iron and ironing board, coffee pot and a mini-fridge. Bathroom was very small with only a shower and no bathtub. The sink was in the room area. They offer a free breakfast in the morning made up of cold and hot cereal along with pastries, bagels, toast, juice and coffee. Only problem was the lack of space in that area. It only seats 20 people and with the hotel's close proximity to the parks, many families were all in the eating area at the same time trying to eat prior to heading to the parks. They do have free internet but it is limited to a single PC in the lobby area. Like most hotels it has a desk in the lobby to help tourists arrange for transportation and tickets for the local attractions. If you are looking for a cheap no frills place to spend the night, this is a good option. I would stay there again given the price.

Reviews.Title: “A heck of a deal for it's location”
Reviews.Author: LoveToRoadTrip99
Reviews.Content: We were originally scheduled to stay at a Super 8 between Orlando and Davenport because of it's low rate- well we got there and realized it was too good to be true--not inviting so we cancelled and started searching. As we drove up International Drive we saw this sitting there, figured the rate would be a shocker since everything else we looked into was $150+ for a basic room, and it was a shocker---just $59 a night. The room was comfy as were the beds and pillows. The shower was unique for a hotel- a walk in that was large. There was a good sized pool- clean and many lounge chairs. A free breakfast- your basic continental fare, but we didn't touch it much as we were eating at the parks but it was good and plenty. The staff at the desk were very friendly and helpful too. The location is outstanding- right off International Drive (all the restaurants, shops, SeaWorld, Aquatica, ect) and is just a block up from SeaWorld and Aquatica. Only 2 things that caught our attention during our 4 night stay- #1---while we were at SeaWorld during day one, apparently the hotel changed ownership or switched franchises- either way we came back to a hotel with a sign that said Windsor Inn--not a big deal for us as we don't care what the name is but a friendly note would have been nice to expect a change as it was dark and late and we first drove by it. #2--there was a small amount of what appeared to be mold- from moisture on the ceiling above the shower--perhaps need a better exhaust fan. Overall for the price and location this place is a super deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centralized location, nice hotel but don't rely on the shuttle”
Reviews.Author: pmerick63
Reviews.Content: The hotel was acceptable but ask for a room on a lower floor. Our first room was on the 4th floor and the toilet didn't flush well. We asked to be moved and they put us in another 4th floor room, but it had the same problem. We asked again to be moved and ended up on the first floor with no problems at all! The staff was very friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast was great and the outdoor pool was very nice. Once we got an acceptable room, our stay was very good with no issues. Now the shuttle offered was a whole different story! The hotel offers a free shuttle to and from the parks but there are limited pickup and drop off times, so keep that in mind during your planning. The shuttle to Universal studios was later in the morning, so we chose to pay for a cab to get there when the park opened. Besides that, the shuttle bus was very run down and in bad shape, to the point that we were concerned that it would even make it to the parks! And of course this wasn't the only hotel on the route - there were several stops before and after the Sleep Inn. The most frustrating situation is that one driver would stop at each hotel and grab a cup of coffee or a banana at the continental breakfast, even if we were way behind schedule. When someone made a comment about being behind schedule, the driver just stated that the parks don't open until 9:00 anyway, not taking into consideration that some of use were taking additional transportation to get to other parks. That was another drawback - if you were going to the Disney properties, you got dropped off and picked up at Epcot and Epcot only. If you wanted to go to the Animal Kingdom, you had to take a shuttle to Magic Kingdom then a bus to Animal Kingdom. This ended up being a 90 minute commute from the hotel! If we knew it would have taken that long, we would have taken a cab! As far as local food, there was a Village Inn right by the hotel and a little further down the road, there was an AWESOME italian restaurant in a strip mall. We went there for supper twice and were VERY pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Our first experience of Sleep Inn. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TnM_1
Reviews.Content: We booked a King bed room. The value is superb. The location is a 10 minute WALK to Sea World! Fantastic! Free internet, parking and breakfast add to the value. The Manager was very friendly with recommendations of restaurants. Sleep Inn is able to offer a personal service when compared to more expensive competitors. In the strip mall next door are several restaurants and bars .Fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: rindsay
Reviews.Content: Sleep Inn is a gem! Nothing fancy, but clean and quiet, and reasonably close to all the main Orlando attractions. There are a few restaurants within walking distance, and Sea World is about a 10 minute walk as well. My room was clean and reasonably spacious. It had an internet hookup (with a REALLY short cord) at the desk; it was free to log on, but every 6 hours or so you get booted off and have to sign in again. (I worked from my hotel room for a couple days, so it happened a few times.) The staff were very friendly and helpful; the towels and linens were clean. Breakfast was nothing fancy but there was plenty of it. Parking out front got a little crowded in the evening, and the back lots weren't terribly well-lit, but it wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: shar4813
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel as we had not made reservations. We just stop there and they were just wonderful... The hotel is clean, quiet, and comfortable. I would highly recommend them to anyone. We found a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “1st time visit to florida - couldn't have been better, long review”
Reviews.Author: bumblebee89
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 21nights for my 21st birthday - as the title says we couldn't be happier. It's got a brilliant location, so if you're there for Disney/Universal/Seaworld etc, it's a brill spot. Due to the location, the trolley (green bus with the face on front of it) is rarely full when you get on, when you use it, you'll know what I'm talking about. The maids were fantastic too I must say, the room was kept to a very high standard, bear in mind we were there for 3 weeks and not one day of the stay did we have any complaints with the cleaning - this must say something. Room wise, the bathroom was on the modest size with a shower only, but come on, when you're in Florida, you're not there to spend hours in the bathroom anyway. Sufficient enough to do the job and clean. The breakfast area was on the small side, again nothing which bothered us as we didn't use it. To first time Orlando travellers, if you're using the complimentary shuttle service to parks, but want to come home sooner, you can. The Lynx bus stops outside the hotel! Lynx busses run from Disney and Universal, so if you don't hire a car like we didn't, all is not lost. We tended to find that the shuttles were very limited, so do your homework before you go so you're prepared. I would also advise anyone to take their own food to the parks, we didn't for the first week, and spent an absolute fortune! There is a Subway 2 seconds away from the hotel, so we were buying food from here and taking it with us - saved us an absolute fortune! Another tip too, when you get to the parks, it's cheaper to drink fizzy drinks than water... What I did was buy one of the refillable cups, but only got it filled with ice, then used a water fountain to fill the rest up. This is something else which saved us a fortune, which gave us money for more things, ie HALLOWEEN HORROR NIGHTS!!! =) We walked to Seaworld everyday we went which was fab. You must also try the Village Inn restuaraunt next door, this was our first taste to American food, and it just got better from there! My fiancee proposed to me whilst in Disneyland, when we got back we were cream crackered, so went to the Village Inn for the millionth time lol, when we told them, we got our meal for free! How's that for hospitality?! Oh, and another really helpful hint if you're going to stay here - don't use the dry cleaning! Well, you can, but you will pay quite a lot for it (respectively). After we paid for our dry cleaning, we noticed a self service washing area on the second floor - gutted! In all fairness we weren't told about this, but we didn't ask either, so no-one is to blame. But at least my fellow travellers know this now after reading this essay ;) Buy ALL your park tickets before you go - they will NOT be cheaper out there, but you will see a lot of stands offering cheap tickets, believe me, we looked at them all out of interest, but none were actually cheaper. The hotel let us check out later as our flight back to Manchester wasn't until 6:30 - we really appreciated this. All in all a brilliant holiday, and we're going back in a couple of years to try the new roller coasters at Busch gardens! Clean, sufficient and did the job, overall, a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and nice people”
Reviews.Author: LisaA1970
Reviews.Content: My husband came to the Orlando area for business and I came for pleasure. The hotel staff accommodated us very well. He requested a suite and was moved immediately to one for the same price. They also allowed us a late check out. The rooms were very clean, the pool was nice. Let's not forget the Waffle House was right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at a perfect price”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 16 nights at a jaw-dropping Â£20 per night, thanks to a mix of cashback, vouchers and a discount on a large broker website. And WHAT a bargain it was! Everything was perfect. The room was cleaned to a very high standard every day. The soundproofing and blackout curtains were superb. We never really heard anything or were kept awake by the floodlit car park. The staff were very friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The daytime front desk member of staff gave us some great tips for Disney. There is a free shuttle bus that leaves every day for the parks, twice for Epcot, with 8.10 and 10.40am drop off with return at 6.40 or 10pm - usually enough time to see the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom and make a run for it to get back. The drivers were great and were on time. You can see SeaWorld from the upper rooms, but ironically we never went there on this occasion. This was our first holiday in Florida using public transport exclusively. Car hire and even taxis were out of the question. With this hotel, you simply don't need to hire a car. From Terminal A at MCO, head towards the local bus stops just outside on the far right hand side as you exit from ground level. They cost just $2 and you get dropped off across the street from the hotel. The 111 Lynx service is quicker, taking around 30 minutes and the 42 took a much longer hour and a half. Stupidly, the buses aren't really designed for carrying luggage but the services we used were quiet enough to not deprive anyone of a seat. The drivers and fellow travellers were really helpful and friendly. I'd say even more so than the i-Ride Trolley (you can buy day/week passes from the hotel reception). This also stops outside the hotel. When the i-Ride had problems during one day of our stay, we just hopped on the Lynx to get back to the hotel from International Drive. The room itself was big with complimentary toiletries, coffee maker, plenty of towels, cable TV with HBO and a wired LAN connection for computers (cable thoughtfully provided). There is no Wi-Fi in the rooms, only at reception. It's not very quick to be honest and did struggle with lots of people using it, but better than data roaming costs. There is a complimentary buffet style breakfast every morning. Toast, muffins, coffee, cereal, pastries, fruit cocktail and porridge. It was always really busy, finding a seat inside when the seating ran out was the only real issue we had. But you could at least sit outside. I regret not asking for a fridge in the room, but the ice makers made up for it to an extent. We used the washing & drying machines which cost $2 for each and helped us travel light. Our dining out options were largely the Village Inn next door, which was great and Flippers Pizzeria. For snacks and booze we used the petrol station and the liquor store. All are about a safe 5 minutes walk away The reception staff say that the hotel is about to change to a Best Western, so it will be interesting to see what happens to it. They did reveal that a big refurb programme is on the cards, with an upgrade to flat screen TVs, etc due from April. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. It's outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carribbeanfun
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the sleep inn for a few nights in February/March. very good location just off I drive (which probably made it a bit quieter than many on I Drive itself) and next door to seaworld (walking distance). rooms v comfortable and spacious. free buffet breakfast was fine, nothing spectacular but enough to fill you up before a day at a theme park. hotel rate includes free shuttle to universal, disney and seaworld, we used this once to go to universal which was ok but turned up about half an hour late in the morning to pick us up. hotel pool was nice and kept v clean. reception staff were friendly. overall i would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Joshua5664
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed theire for 14 days and whe loved it.The rooms where nice the price was cheap and we walked to go to seaworld and aquatica.They have free shuttle to go to the theme parks.The breakfast is quiet simple but theyre is plenty.The rooms where cleans and i really recommend this hotel if i had to go back to orlando i would be booking at the same place.The front lady was really nice to us and helped us.The only inconvinient is the free internet that is unstable but still usable.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay”
Reviews.Author: jmdDubuqueIowa
Reviews.Content: the pictures on the internet do not do justice.this place sucks! the room smelled (my husband even said this and for a guy to say something you know it is bad)and the the beds were so small you had to sleep on your side.we booked 1 room some how we ended up with 4.We did not get the room they said we were going to get and had to interrup the guy at the front desk and take him away from his computer.We were going to stay for a week and checked out less then 12 hrs of checking in.They did not even ask why we were leaving.I learned something from this stay never go by bthe pictures on the computer.Do not be fooled by all the good things they say this hotel has they lie! They do not have free internet in the rooms you need to stand out in the hall and use your computer.Stay accross the street at the Double Tree that is were we went much nicer and alot better all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: marciofleury
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and provide a great value if you want a "bed and breakfast" hotel. It is simple but clean. Just this. Pros: - Good location: easy access to outlets and parks - Cordial receptionists - Parking and breakfast included in the price - Free internet access Cons: - Thin walls: you can hear the noise of other rooms - Windows without cover: you can see the rooms from outside the hotel - Only wired internet in the rooms - Internet connection very unstable - Very simple breakfast - Manual air conditioning and misplaced (below the curtain)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: FirstNo
Reviews.Content: I live in the area, but once a year I take off from work on a Monday so I can stay late at Halloween Horror Nights at Universal and then go to Sea World on a weekday (less people than a weekend). After a bad experience at a local hotel a few years ago, I had been driving home; very tired and turning around to go back to close to where I was the next morning. This year, I started searching again and came across this hotel. I certainly didn't expect much and perhaps that's why I was pleasantly surprised. I arrived at the hotel about 2pm on Sunday and my room was ready. First floor (as requested). The room had 2 beds, a desk, a safe and a tv with good reception. I turned the a/c up and had no problem with it when I returned many hours later. Neither that night (I got back about 1am) nor the next morning (up about 7am) did I hear the sound of children running down the halls (as happens in many Disney resorts). It was quiet. People closed their doors quietly insead of letting them slam shut. The continental breakfast was as advertised and more than plenty for even a picky person like me. There were 3 kinds of cerals (I had cornflakes) and a number of muffins, bagels and doughnuts (had a choc chip muffin). There were juices and coffee (I had milk). From what I saw, the pool was very small, but I liked that all the doors were locked at 11pm and you had to have the desk clerk buzz you in, as well as inside entrances. As a woman travelling alone, I preferred that extra security. My only complaint is if I had to have spent more time there, the poor set up of the sink outside the bathroom and the way the bathroom door was would have driven me nut. But, for the price I paid and everything the hotel had to offer, I couldn't have been happier. If you're in town for a short time or you're a local who plans a late night at City Walk/Uni or Sea World and don't want to drive home, I'd have no problem recommending this establishment. Received a fantastic rate at Hotels.com. No problem checking in (staff were pleasant and polite). The room was clean and I felt safe. For what I wanted to do, this place worked out perfectly and the price couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “lovelly hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacksonMidlands
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 14 nights, this was a last minute booking change from our first choice hotel ( so glad we did change). On arrival greeted by receptionist how was very helpfull. We had to make couple of trips to front desk as electronic key did not work, but soon put right. Only some of the rroms have fridges and it is cheaper to pre book otherwise it is 7 dollars a day, we managed without a fridge. The rooms are average size but just right, storage would be tight for family of 4. Beds are queen size and comfortable. There is an in room electronic safe. Lift to all floors, mini toiletries, coffee maker, radio clock alarm and great aircon. TV with HBO Plenty of hot water and shower is good, towels changed daily and maid service is great. The hotel provides shuttles to theme parks disney has two slots in morning, but the others only one. Disney has to return times 530 pm or 10pm. Between these times you can catch a lynx bus 111 from disney that stops across road from hotel, it also can take you from out side the hotel costs 2 dollars per person. they run very half hour. The swimming pool is small and we did not use it. the hotel has a cold buffet breakfast, which was good and fresh, consisted of cerals 3 different varities, toast, english muffins, muffins, danish pastries and also porridge. The fresh fruit juice was the best we tasted during our stay in orlando. There is also a micro wave you can use. There is free WI FI which my son found great. There is a washing machine and tumble dyer on the 2nd floor 2 dollers each machine. I know the last thing oyu want to be doing on holiday is washing but saves doing when you get home. Final point is the hotel main doors and side enterences can only be entered by using room key, and room doors are accessed from inside the hotel. I had a great stay here and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Rovshana
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything bad about Sleep Inn @Convention Center. Very clean room, comfy beds and good customer service. Breakfast was modest but very good. Served in a small area though so make sure that you're not late. Two important (and I believe useful) notes - there's only Family restaurant close by and a small grocery y store at Gas station. The good thing is that the Hotel is located on International drive and there is a I-Ride Trolley station next to the hotel. There are lots of dining, shopping places, attractions and major sea parks on International drive and I-Ride trolley can take you there for only $1.25 per person. That was very convenient! Not the best shuttle bus to theme parks though (small and full).

Reviews.Title: “TOILET HOOKED TO HOT WATER LINE”
Reviews.Author: pittston
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on Sunday August 22, 2010. I did not use the toilet until Monday August 23 at which time I discovered that plumbing repairs had caused the HOT water line to be hooked to the toilet. This created a horrible aroma inside of the room as all items "deposited" into the toilet immediately cooked in 120-degree water. I can also assure you that personal body parts were made to feel very uncomfortable as a result of sitting that close to hot water. When I reported this problem to the front desk, the young lady told me, "Yes - We learned that all rooms ending in the number "1" have had this same problem since repairs were done in June. I was in room 301. I asked the lady for a refund of my money and she informed me that she could not do that as I had secured this reservation through Hotels.com but she appologized for my inconvenience. I find this 2-month long maintenance problem to be more than an inconvenience. It is a health and safety problem. This is the first time in my life that I have asked a hotel for a refund. You would think that a $59 refund would be worth more than the exposure of their indifference toward the health and safety of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: me2008ManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here before we went we felt armed with realistic expectations. On arrival the check in was quick but with limited information given about the amenities. The rooms were clean and comfortable, we had 2 double rooms, one for us and one for the kids (16 and 18). The double rooms had very large beds in and one bed was big enough for 2 of you to sleep in. The rooms all had safes ans air conditioning, a coffee maker and an iron/ironing board. The TV had numerous channels and was great for watching when you had an early night or morning off the parks. There is a laundry with washer and dryer and they have a supply of washing powder and fabric conditioner you can buy. There is no fridge in the rooms which you may expect with the usual mini bar, but there are vending machines for non-alcoholic drinks and snacks. The pool was fine for a quick dip. Location-wise the hotel is right near a bus stop to go to Florida Mall and Disney, as well as the I-ride to International Drive. There is also a great diner next door - Tim the waiter is a favourite for this family. There is a store and a subway within 5 mins as well as both Indian and Italian restaurants/takeaways, though they are dearer than the diner. The negatives - the breakfast is very limited, cereal, muffins, danish, juice, toast, tea and coffee. There is no cooked breakfast but I am a veggie and that doesn't bother me. It can also get a bit crowded in the breakfast room as there are only about a dozen tables and not much space to move, it is basically a part of reception and not a separate room, the coffee is available all day though. Also we found it very noisy in the mornings in your room as fellow guests just let their doors slam shut instead of closing it quietly. Overall the stay was comfortable and all you need is there, staff were pleasant and helpful and as we were out all day the limited facilities were not an issue, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for Sea World visitors!”
Reviews.Author: nmiller73
Reviews.Content: HI, first time leaving a review here but I have to give high marks for this hotel. Not only is it afffordable but literally just a few blocks from Sea World and Aquatica. Our family lives in Florida but a couple hours from the attractions. This was a perfect hotel choice for us. It is a sleep in so it's not luxury, but clean and more than adequate with a friendly staff. This will be our hotel of choice any time we enjoy a two day adventure at sea world and aquatica, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sonja96
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, close to all major attractions and easy to find. Rooms were large, clean and well maintained. All staff were pleasant and helpful. Pool was large and clean. Continental breakfast was fresh and good, though not as extensive as some places I've stayed. Still adequate! Will definitely stay here again while visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: 60195Sherry022
Reviews.Content: I booked the flight and hotel through Expedia, I thought the cost was fair and it was very easy to do. The hotel was fine- the beds and pillows were comfortable and the A/C was cold, the room was clean and the front desk was helpful. I did have one complaint with my request for a taxi for our early AM departure to the airport. The next morning when I arrived in the lobby the front desk had set us up with a Lincoln Towncar, NOT a taxi like we had arranged. That is the service they have some arrangement with. I ended up paying more since I wasn't about to send him away and wait for another ride at 4AM. Also the water in the rooms does smell like sulfer. I bought a gallon of water from the overpriced gas station next door for drinking. We did benefit from the public buses, they stop right in front of the hotel. It's inexpensive but you do put in your time waiting, 1/2 hr seemed average without a bench at many stops. The drivers were very friendly assisting us with directions to the malls, etc. We even took the bus from the airport as we arrived early and the room wasn't near ready so for $3 bus fare we avoided a $45 taxi ride! A warning to all, do not order food from the pamphlets slipped under your room door! It's understood that this is a scheme to get your credit card #, also they said the pizza's are probably made in someone's garage or worse! That's if they even deliver the food. Sad, huh? They warned us on the TV, the tourist channel there, but for those who don't hear about it ,yikes! One last thing, we did the walk from Seaworld after the park closed rather than getting the shuttle so early. The path leads you down a dark, scary side street with a vacant lot next to it. a lot of overgrowth and a perfect place in my opinion for trouble. We joined up with another family and were able to cut through thier gated hotel parking lot to avoid that , I woudn't have been comfortable otherwise and do not recommend that route. We loved HP World at Universal and aslo Seaworld, the all inclusive meal deals were also a good deal to look into while your there. We also did Wet and wild, FUN! And Aquatica-not fun! We had the Flex pass so we tried it but left that place early as they had reached capacity and it was insane! Not one place to sit and the lines were sooo long! Plus both waterparks sock it to you for a locker fee! After such expensive admissions they should really include them, always a catch! I would recommend staying here if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: ithomas102
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Expedia for an amazing price. First off, the location is excellent--it is right on the I-Drive live, and so you can take a very affordable trolley down I-Drive to find great restaurants, attractions, shops, and malls. They sell passes very cheap, we got a 5-day for $8. Beware though--the trolleys can get unbelievably crowded, so if you are claustrophobic you're better getting a taxi. The room was great, very clean, nice air conditioner, TV, coffeemaker, etc. The ONLY problem we have is that the tap water is pretty disgusting--tastes like it has a little sulfur in it. Luckily there is a gas station right next to the hotel, so you can stock up on CLEAN water there...that or the vending machines on each level. Some people on here complained about the complementary breakfast...umm its FREE so why are you complaining? They offered a few types of cereals, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, small danishes, juices, milk, toast, coffee, and canned fruit. If you want a more full breakfast, there is a Village Inn next door, or a McDs down the block. The shuttles to the parks were wonderful--they had a pickup time for Universal Studios at 9:35am daily, and pickup times at 5:30pm and 6:45pm. Fast, convenient, and reliable! Overall, we had a wonderful time here and would happily come back for another visit to the area!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a nights stay.”
Reviews.Author: blanktgrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean enough. The beds were very clean. That is a must for me. They were a little on the small side. The bathroom kind of smelled. It was a good location to go to Sea World. I felt safe and it was nice and quiet. For the price I would say it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable choice”
Reviews.Author: LandyLover
Reviews.Content: Lots of pluses: friendly welcome at the front desk, clean rooms, hot showers, comfortable beds, free high-speed internet, self-service laundry if you need to do some washing, good value accommodation. Close to the convention centre, SeaWorld and other tourist attractions - they apparently run a shuttle bus to these places although I didn't use it. Only negative points were the breakfast area was cramped in the morning for the number of people staying, and the breakfast choice wasn't all that great (muffins/coffee/cereal). Other than that, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Jean at the Frontdesk”
Reviews.Author: familyfun4us2
Reviews.Content: Me and my Family often take trips to Orlando. But usually never get lost lol. But after seaching for our hotel for an hour and asking other hotels for directions to no availe. I stopped in to the Sleep INN and Jean at the front desk was outstanding he took the time to PRINT me a map as well as directions. Saving my family and me valuable time and frustration. He went above and beyond my expectations and definatly will chose to stay at this hotel next time. Many thanks John C.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Sea World.”
Reviews.Author: jetq88
Reviews.Content: Wifi did not work. If you turn on the heat , then the room will start smelling like something is burning, and it won't go away until after on hour. We had sit outside in the freezing cold for brreakfast because the dining room was too small. There was free children TV, overall hotel was "kid-friendly".

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for Sea World and Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: kd6ac
Reviews.Content: We settled on this hotel after finding out that they have FREE shuttle service to Sea World AS WELL as to Disney, although we had already completed our Disney trip by the time we moved to this place. For the price that includes Free breakfast, free internet in the room (with a cat 5 cable that is provided), a pretty clean room , quiet A/C, and pretty central location, this place is the ideal for the budget travellers. Considering also that almost the whole day would be spend in the parks, and the kids would need to be carried to bed by night time, we didn't need a roomy place, so we found this place hightly agreeable. The pillows were also comfortable for me as I usually find issues with hotel pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: maynard7
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place a lot. The room was attractive and clean. I had a nice view of Sea World from my window. They had free internet terminals on the 1st and 2nd floors. My room was quiet. Plenty of free parking. They made free photocopies for me at the front desk. Much better than the hotel I stayed at the night before. The hotel seems like it's only a few years old. I would definitely stay here again if in the Sea World area.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for the price”
Reviews.Author: UCFKnightsFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in November 2009. I live north of Orlando and I had a conference at the DoubleTree Resort directly across the street. Because I had to pay for my lodging out of pocket, I opted not to stay at the convention hotel because it was $129.00 per night. I got the room at the Sleep Inn for $31.99 per night with my college's alumni association rate! For this rate it was a steal! I was in a 4th floor room. It was clean, quiet, and fine for the price. The front desk clerk spoke English and was efficient, friendly, and nice. Just an FYI......you CANNOT walk to the Orange County Convention Center from here, but it is close by. It is also very close to Aquatica - SeaWorld's Waterpark, SeaWorld, and TGI Friday's. You can walk to a Village Inn Restaurant, Subway Restaurant, italian restaurant, chinese restaurant, and liquor store. Because of the price, the room and location were both PERFECT for me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place”
Reviews.Author: RCINassau
Reviews.Content: I think for the awesome rates you get here you can not go wrong. My daugter and I stayed for 4 nights at the end of August ... it was our big farewell to summer trip before school began .. girls only trip! We had an awesome time. The loaction is PERFECT if you plan to visit sea world and aquatica especially ... you can walk there (which we did every day) and if your too lazy to walk those couple minutes you can wait for the I trolly that will take you there for $1.25 (free for kids) The I trolly is also an excellent affordable option for getting to shopping or further away eating options. Personally my daugher and I loved just eating at the Village Inn next door who also gave 10% discounts to guest of our hotel .. yummy and affordable food even without the discount I might add. The room was clean and had all the basics you require in a room .. not huge but when all you basically need is a comfortabel place to sleep and plan on being out at the parks most of the day anyway does it really matter? The Free breakfast was decent and always well stocked and had more then adequate selection .. and don't forget people it is FREE so stop complaining. The staff and the Manager were all friendly and helpful and were always willing to answer my million questions. Honestly I don't think it is possible to get a better value for dollar anywhere else in Orlando and I would not hesitate to stay here again!! Big thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Teacher2nd
Reviews.Content: Not fancy, but a good value for the money. Close to SeaWorld. We walked, less than 1 mile. You had to go through other places and a fence(had a gate). Breakfast was okay. Ample parking. No unresolved problems during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant hotel, excellent for comvention centre”
Reviews.Author: smurf77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sleep Inn while attending a conference at the Convention Centre which is just 5 mins walk away (ask reception for the short cut). The hotel itself was very good, the breakfast was a bit basic, tea, coffee, toast, jam, porridge, muffins and Danish pastries, but it sees you through till lunch. Satellite TV and internet (not WIFI, but cables are installed in the rooms) means you can catch up on emails and wind-down watching a movie after a long day. Rooms also have an iron, ironing board, safe, air-conditioning and fridge. There is a mini market just next door for essentials and a restaurant. The pool was small, but sufficient for a quick dip and they have sun loungers to relax on. There is also a washing machine and dryer on site for guest use which is excellent and a water/soft drinks/ice machine. The hotel is also across the road from the Plaza which is a pick up point for lots of organised tours as well. Staff were all very helpful, polite and full of advice and helpful tips. An all round excellent hotel ,especially if you are in Orlando for the Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away any place is better than this”
Reviews.Author: myatravelingrose
Reviews.Content: Let alone is the staff rude but the hotel is dirty and they do not stand behind what they offer. The manager Richard said he could do nothing about the stains on the sheets bc house keeping has left for the day when we noticed them. Obviously we should have checked the sheets before going out to enjoy the day at Universal. And Why couldnt he at least hand me a pair for me to swap out since he didnt want to do his job since "house keeping wasnt there". Awful hotel STAY AWAY....

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention Center but that's all”
Reviews.Author: MinnScooter
Reviews.Content: We were in town for one night to attend a Trade show and stayed here because we could walk to the convention center. It was in dire need of a makeover!! the carpet was stained, one of the chairs had a HUGE stain in the seat! the bathroom was outdated and had rust stains in the fixtures. The parking lot was very much like a lot you'd see in the Islands ( overgrown with weeds, potholes etc) The only thing good about this was the location and even that had a big drawback- In order to walk tothe convention Center you had to walk up & over a steep overpass- not real fun in 93 degree temps!

Reviews.Title: “Worst budget hotel, ever.”
Reviews.Author: hairess09
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Orlando for a show at the Convention Center, first this is definitely not in walking distance unless you want to walk over busy intersections and freeways. When I called and asked for more towels the front desk informed me they don't have room service and that I needed to walk around the halls and look for a maid and ask !! She also said they don't have walkie talkies when I asked if they could contact them as I was in my pajamas. The front desk is un-knowledgeable about the area and their own policies. They are all foreign and barely speak English. I felt uncomfortable the whole time and the room was dirty and smelled like smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traci_the_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2009 in a room with 2 double beds. There were four of us in the room - myself plus 3 teenagers. The room was fine and clean but it was small and a little crowded with luggage etc. The location of the hotel was great - it was easy acees to the highway to get to Disney, Universal and the airport. The hotel was also a quiet one - I did not have any complaints with noise in other rooms or in the hall way - which was a wonderful The breakfast was a bit of a let down. I had hoped there would be more selections present as well as peanut butter for my english muffin. The breakfast items were well stocked though and they were quick to replenish. My only disappointment was one staff member who was working the night shift. My daugher had left her shoes behind in the breakfast room and realized it a day later. She went to the front desk and inquired and the lady working the desk didn't even bother looking up from the computer and told her that they didn't have them. She made no effort to look at all. The next morning I went to the front desk and inquired with different staff and when I described them they pulled the shoes out immediately without having to look - which was great. I would stay here again as the price and location was right. I would just bring my own peanut butter :)

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to SeaWorld but that's all it has going for it”
Reviews.Author: Jason69850
Reviews.Content: I'm not a hotel snob. I like the Best Western/Comfort Inn type of hotels. I wasn't expecting the Ritz for $59 a night - I really wasn't, but this hotel was below my expectations. It is walking distance to Seaworld which is good since there was only one shuttle a day. However, it's a long walk and while it was fine for 2 adult men to walk through parking lots and across busy streets, I would not recommend that you could do it with children. Judging from the strip mall adjacent to the hotel, this is a rather sketchy part of Orlando, and even though I'm 6'1 200lbs, I didn't feel entirely safe walking around it day or night. The hotel itself is rather sad. The room we had was tiny, noisy and rather old. The modling on the shower (there is no bathtub just a shower) was chipped rather badly exposing the plaster. You can hear the hallway noise very distinctly and since it's a hotel near a theme park, that means that you can hear kids screaming down the halls day and night. The free breakfast is a joke. It's in a tiny alcover off the front desk and there is no room to even get a muffin or a juice since it's always filled to 500% capacity so you can't even reach the food. The other "amenity" is even worse - free internet. Don't assume it's free wireless like most modern hotels, it's a very short ethernet cable so you are forced to use the internet in a very uncomfortable rickety old chair. We were there 3 nights and said internet was down (With a green apology screen) about half the time. The front desk staff were a little curt at times, and not overly friendly (and I wasn't asking for anything other than directions). Probably the worst part about it was the smell of the room. IT had an awful smell of some chemical, maybe bug repellent? that was overpowering whenever you walked in the room. During the days, the maids would turn off the air conditioner so that made it even worse when we returned. There are so many hotels along internation drive. For the same price, the Best Western Movieland or Clarion Universal are 1000% nicer. We wanted to get to Sea World and Discovery Cove very early so we thought it would be nice to stay here, but we would never stay here again. and would advise you to stay further down international drive and take the shuttles. You're sort of trapped here. There is a Village Inn restaurant next door and a strip mall, but it looks very much like the worst neighborhood of an inner city and like I said, I was anxious walking around the area which does look like the worst parts of an inner city and since the hotel itself has no food to speak of, I don't see how/where you would eat on an extended stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask for anything at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Littlefootann
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average. It was a good value at $50 a night. Meaning it had a bed, was relatively clean and close to a bus stop. The staff have absolutely no idea about anything in the area so don't bother asking them. Call the hotel across the street and ask them. Breakfast was very slim with not much variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: ZedIndia
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed at the Sleep Inn (near Convention Center), Orlando, from 26 April to 4 May 2009 (8 nights). The hotel looks nice from the outside and I could see ample free car parking as I entered the hotel via the Mears shuttle service that I had booked online (by the way, Mears shuttle is a good, efficient and reliable service that I would recommend). The reception staff were friendly. I arrived at 1 pm and requested for an early check-in and they obliged me. All through my stay, I found the reception staff very pleasant and helpful. The room was airconditioned, with an iron and a telephone. Local calls are free. The room decor was nice and the room was fair sized (unlike some of the European hotels I have been to). The rooms have been recently renovated as they looked new. Overall the hotel was neat and clean. I liked the rooms. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. There is free WiFi internet all over the hotel. There are also 3 computers for use by hotel guests (free). The free breakfast had muffins, coffee, toast and juice - quality was just about average and this was the only disappointing part of the stay - but the breakfast was free and filled your tummy! There is a free shuttle service to DisneyWorld (the shuttle bus drops you off at Epcot Center and you can then use the free disney monorail or free disney buses to go to the other disney theme parks from there) and SeaWorld. The bus is small and on some occassions, many people had to stand in the bus - but the bus was reliable. At a 2 minutes walk from the hotel is SUBWAY sandwiches. At a 12 mins walk is McDonalds (1 stop away by the I-ride trolley). If you do need to shop at a convenience store, do not use the one next to SUBWAY as its expensive and hardly has a range of products. Take the I-ride trolley and get to a Walgreens store and do your purchases. Overall i found this a fantastic place to stay at and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Meets Basic Needs”
Reviews.Author: cbbi
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were looking for a clean, affordable hotel near Seaworld.
