Positives for us: room was clean, AAA rate less than $70/night booked in advance, location easy to find and convenient to Seaworld, comfortable queen beds instead of doubles, plenty of pillows, linens clean. Staff was helpful and pleasant. We did not find the hotel noisy at all, kids enjoyed the small swimming pool. Negatives: We are non smokers and I chose the hotel because it was non smoking. There were filled overflowing containers for cigarette butts next to every entry door. It just made the hotel feel icky to me. (On the plus side there was no smell of smoke inside the hotel.) The room was very small, very basic, and felt humid. We did walk to Seaworld as recommended by another reviewer. I would not walk with young children and not during the hot summer months. The sidewalk ended at one point and there was also construction to walk through during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up to Sleep Inn Convention Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtatraveler09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in September 2008. We were attending an event and our travel agent recommended this hotel because we wanted to stay close to the convention center. We paid about USD 60 per night so we didn't have high expectations but we were happily surprised. The location is definitely great if you are attending an event at the Convention Center, actually it is just a 10 minute walk away. The hotel has free parking, an outdoor pool and complimentary breakfast (very plain and simple but enough to get going) which consisted of muffins, bagels, jam, coffee, milk , juice and some fruit. There is also free of charge Internet in the rooms. The breakfast area is tiny, but there is a small yard outside with some tables and chairs (also good for smokers). Next to the elevators there is a laundry machine and a computer with Internet connection. Our room was spacious, with 2 queen size beds. The only thing we didn't like was that it had a strong humidity smell but we figured that it was because of the climate. Other than that, our stay was very pleasant and the staff was polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SarahnJ0hn
Reviews.Content: We were given a friendly reception on our arrival and our request to move from the ground floor arranged with ease. The room was perfectly adequate (2 Queen sized comfortable beds) and clean. Breakfast was from 6.30 and offered hot porriidge - delicious, a variety of cereal, toast, muffins and pastries, coffee and fruit juice also there was no problem with taking muffins and pastries for a snack later. The location was excellent offereing a 10 minute WALK to seaworld saving the $12 car parking fee. Hey it wasn't the HIlton but for the price it was great!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for families-close to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: love2travelArk
Reviews.Content: The first thing i noticed was that the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was a little small but very clean and cozy. The breakfast and pool were nice! In a good location

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this very clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyandmissy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying 17 nights at Sleep Inn and want to share our experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the beds were comfy, but the most impressive thing is that this hotel is absolutely immaculate! If you're fussy about cleanliness, you should stay here. The free breakfast, while modest, is very nice. Hot and cold cereal, toast, muffins and rolls, orange juice and coffee. Who needs more than that? Great location, too.

Reviews.Title: “This was very nice”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFlorida40
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable beds, helpful staff. Will return :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient location with nice extras”
Reviews.Author: ssiemon
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, conveniently located close to convention center and theme parks (although I never go to those). Right on inexpensive trolley route to other areas with a few restaurants and mini-mart close by. Clean rooms with nice continental breakfast and free HBO and Showtime.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Arjsan
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sleep Inn as it was close to Seaworld and Aquatica. To Seaworld you can really walk, however the entrance to Aquatica is a bit further away. We walked, but would recomend the car. Everything else is close drive distance. The hotel itself is a bit dated, but had everything we needed. Rooms were fairly large and clean. Staff was friendly and helpfull. Overall good value for money, will stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Talera
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with the Sleep Inn. The hotel was not fancy but it was very clean and quiet. We enjoyed the free continential breakfast which had a better than average selection of items. I found the hotel staff to be very helpful and really appreciated the free computer and printer useage in the lobby. The was very close to Sea World and Aquatica. I chose to drive to the parks as our kids are young and would probably not have been able to handle the walk back to the hotel at the end of the day. It is very easy to get to shopping and wide selection of places to eat ( Walmart, Outlet Mall, Macoroni Grill, Olive Garden, Friday's, Fast Food, Etc.) in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: ernandcable
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice an clean. The staff was friendly. The showers were hot and the beds were cozy. The location was close to Sea World and not too far from Disney. The continental breakfast was lacking. If you want breakfast go next door to the Village Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Good Value...Clean Room....Very Friendly helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: perry_fl_guy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Dec 28, 07 to Jan 2, 08 location was great. Sea World was almost next door, plenty of resturants nearby. 7-11 a few doors down and I-4 trolly makes a stop at hotel. Cost $ 1.00 each way and stops along International Drive. No need to drive to dine or shop. Nice breakfast area where u can make your own waffles. Staff was great with any questions asked. I wished they had free wifi in the rooms, it's only in the lobby/breakfast area. Rooms were clean, good selection on tv (freeHBO) only draw back was room was small and if the parking lot was full, you had to park in a lot behind hotel. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but getting a little old now - needs refurb”
Reviews.Author: nickdolphins
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I have stayed at this hotel many times and the location simply cannot be beaten - right on 528 and I4 plus all parks, etc on the doorstep. It used to be a very clean hotel but since last year it is really showing it's age - it's not so much that the maid's are not doing there jobs, etc but the rooms are simply ready for a refurb! Carpet, bedding, etc all a little faded now - scuffs on most walls, etc, etc. Receptionist was very sullen and I couldn't get a word out of her. If you get this room on a voucher for $47 a night then go for it - location great and I have stayed is worse hotels!

Reviews.Title: “great value near sea world”
Reviews.Author: tlandin
Reviews.Content: I picked up a coupon at the interstate rest stop, so got a great rate of $48.95. Very clean, kids enjoyed pool, breakfast above average for continental. The walk to Sea World was a little far...wouldn't recommend if leaving park at night....parking is $10, you make your own call. Only complaint was Sal's Pizza which left a coupon in the room...bad, small, expensive pizza, but not really hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for basic stay, very close to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: TurnersTips
Reviews.Content: The only reason we decided to stay here was because it's cheap, has free parking and is 10 mins walking distance to SeaWorld. We left our car in the car park during the day after check-out and walked - so you can take off $10 or so that you would've paid for parking at SeaWorld. We grabbed a coupon book that gave us a weekend rate of $51 plus tax. That included a fresh waffle / cereal / toast breakfast. We checked in at 10pm and was put in a disabled room on the ground floor - which I guess was slightly larger than the usual room. The bathroom had a large, sportless shower and toilet, and the wash basin was outside the bathroom, in the corner of the bedroom. The beds were comfortable enough, the TV worked and had lots of cable channels, there was a safe, coffee maker and a very small area to hang clothes (but then you're not going to be staying in a place like this for more than a day or two so you won't be unpacking your suitcase!). There was also a pool which we were able to use late at night for a refreshing swim (the water was quite warm). It actually closed at 10pm but the manager allowed us to use it if we were quiet. Yes, this is a budget motel but for the price and what you get for your money I think its a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate! Only fair room.”
Reviews.Author: themenz
Reviews.Content: What can you expect for $65/night? Not so much. Lobby-Very basic with a small sitting area. Travel desk with a person there quite often. Free computer and printing in corner. Room-Very basic but clean. One chair and no desk. Limited space to hang clothes. Nice inroom safe. Bathroom had no counter space-zero-nada. Difficult to place your toiletries. Shower tub combo nice but tricky handle to get the shower water to come on. Low water pressure. 27" standard TV. Decent selection of channels including HBO although many channels were fuzzy. Bed was comfortable but pillows were very thin. In room coffee maker makes one cup at a time. Breakfast was included-The usual waffle maker, some sliced muffins, boiled eggs, sliced sweet bread, pastries, 3 different cereals, coffee, orange juice, and one type of fruit>>oranges of course. Very small seating area (15 people max) but clean. Pool-We did not try it, but it was sparkling clean about 40 X 30 feet next to parking lot with a few umbrellas and plastic chairs. Wireless-Spotty and speed was a bit slow. Sometimes I could not get a signal in my room. They have three computers you can use for free-one sit down in the lobby and two stand up in a balcony on the 2nd floor. Location-Kind of away from things but the shuttle will get you to most places for $1. About a 20 minute walk to the convention center. A few restaurants closeby. Service-Efficient. We called for more pillows and had to go to the lobby to get them ourselves. Staff seemed fairly knowledgeable and most were east European/Russian. Overall I was unhappy with my selection of this hotel. Yes we saved money. But there was no reason to spend any time in your room other than to sleep. Best part was good freeway access so we got to Cocoa beach about an hour away. Fantastic! There is a nice public park right along the ocean with free parking, showers and bathrooms. Very clean beach and water was in the mid 80 degrees. On the way there found a neat homemade ice cream and gelato store. Many flavors and very inexpensive. Excellent!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Orlando Convention Center Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6301 Westwood Blvd., Orlando, FL 32821 (Formerly Sleep Inn at Convention Center)
